message: Could anyone recommend a good place to get business cards printed? I am looking for a company that offers alternative stock and printing methods. I've ordered from vista print and gotprint in the past, I'm looking for something a little more special this time.

Moo is awesome, hands down. UV Cards is my preference for high quality cards at larger quantities. You can ask them for a sample of the various card stocks and styles. The spot UV treatment or rounded corners are really nice.
In Seattle, Girlie Press does fantastic work.
Make sure to use a subtle off white coloring, tasteful thickness, and a watermark (a la American Psycho)
Has anyone run into issues with the fact that Moo business cards are 85x55 mm, which is different than the standard size in North America? http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Business_card#Dimensions

I just got a sample pack from Moo. It's cool that you can get different images printed on each card. I probably wouldn't use that feature though. I didn't notice that they were a different size than the North American Standard, thanks for pointing that out. That doesn't really bother me though, I actually like the proportions of the 85x55 mm. I'm going to check out UV and get samples from them as well, they have the options I was looking for like printing on plastic and foil stamps. Ha, the American Psycho reference. I will do that with my friends once I get my cards.
I've used nextdayflyers.com twice, and had great results both times.
Unless you are a designer, why waste resources on fancy cards?

@grishick Sometimes you meet people, and sometimes you wish to connect with them. However, out of these times, it's not all the time that they have a notebook to take your contact details or are geeky enough to whip out their smartphone and type in your info. 

Sometimes it's still convenient to have cards.
